enhanced_prompt: Explain 'Retrieval-Augmented Generation' (RAG) in 3 simple bullet points. Focus on how it improves AI accuracy by connecting to external data. Contrast it with standard fine-tuning in a 2-column table: | Feature | RAG | Fine-Tuning |. Limit to 60 words.

Provide a concise overview of the OKR (Objectives and Key Results) framework. Define 'Objective' and 'Key Result' in two separate sections. List 3 key benefits for team alignment. Keep the entire explanation under 50 words.

Explain A/B testing for a marketing email campaign. Use a numbered list (max 4 steps) to describe the process from hypothesis to analysis. Conclude with one sentence on its main business value. Output as plain text.

input_prompt: How to run a good meeting
enhanced_prompt: Explain the 3 core components of an effective meeting. Present as a numbered list: 1. Pre-Meeting (Agenda), 2. In-Meeting (Roles), 3. Post-Meeting (Action Items). Provide one key action for each component. Ideal for a Google Docs checklist.

Explain Google Apps Script in 4 bullet points. Focus on its practical use cases for automating tasks between Google Sheets, Docs, and Gmail. Include one example of a simple automation (e.g., 'sending email from a Sheet').

Define the Agile methodology in 3 short sentences, focusing on iterative development and customer feedback. List the 4 main values of the Agile Manifesto as a simple bulleted list. Keep the total output under 60 words.

Summarize these meeting notes in 5 bullet points, focusing on decisions made and action items. For each action item, include: responsible person, deadline, and priority (High/Medium/Low). Present in a table format suitable for Google Docs. Prioritize by urgency.

Summarize the attached marketing campaign report. Extract the 3 most important KPIs (e.g., CTR, Conversion Rate, CPA) and their performance vs. target. List 2 key takeaways and 1 recommendation for the next campaign. Use bullet points.

Summarize this batch of customer feedback. Identify the top 3 recurring themes (2 positive, 1 negative). Provide one direct quote for each theme. Format as a 2-column table: | Theme | Example Quote |. Limit summary to 5 rows total.

Provide a 3-bullet summary of this tech article. Focus on the core problem, the proposed solution, and its main business impact. Conclude with a single sentence on who this technology is for. Keep summary under 50 words.

Condense this project update email into a 3-section summary for stakeholders: 1. Current Status (On-track/Delayed), 2. Key Accomplishments (2 bullets), 3. Blockers (1-2 bullets). Format for quick pasting into Google Chat.

Generate a 3-item meeting agenda for a 'Project Kick-off'. Include sections for: 1. Introductions & Roles, 2. Project Goals & Scope, 3. Next Steps & Owners. Assign a 10-minute time slot for each. Output as a numbered list.

Generate 3 brief social media posts (Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram) for a new product launch. Each post should be under 40 words, include one relevant hashtag, and have a clear call-to-action (CTA). Format with clear headings for each platform.

Generate a simple 4-phase project timeline in a 3-column table: | Phase | Key Milestones (1-2) | Duration (Weeks) |. Use standard phases: 1. Discovery, 2. Design, 3. Development, 4. Deployment. Make this suitable for a Google Slides entry.

Analyze this sales data (CSV). Identify the top 3 performing products by revenue. Find the region with the lowest sales growth. Provide one actionable recommendation to boost the low-performing region. Present as a 3-bullet summary.

Analyze this team workflow description. Identify 2 major bottlenecks or inefficiencies. Suggest 2 specific improvements, focusing on automation or simplification. Format as a 'Problem/Solution' table: | Bottleneck | Recommended Solution |.

Analyze the user experience (UX) of these 3 competitor websites. Rank them from 1 (best) to 3 (worst) based on mobile navigation clarity. List one key strength for the top-ranked site. Provide insights in a 4-line summary.
